name: Weekly Marketing Performance Report
description: Compile and analyze weekly marketing performance across all channels. Track KPIs, identify trends, surface issues, and provide actionable insights for optimization. Keeps leadership and stakeholders aligned on marketing effectiveness.

currentProcess.description: Extract data from multiple marketing platforms
Calculate metrics and compare to goals

painPoints: Signal vs noise in weekly data

aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini handles structured marketing data well

aiProcess.description: Calculate metrics and variance to goals
aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini performs calculations and flags issues
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Metrics table with WoW and goal variance
tips: Include prior week data for comparison

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude identifies patterns and generates insights
tips: Provide context on any campaigns or changes
Ask for both positive and concerning trends

aiProcess.toolRationale: Quick human review; AI formatted the report

whyItMatters: Weekly reporting creates accountability and enables fast optimization. Marketing moves quickly - waiting for monthly reports means missed opportunities. Consistent weekly reporting builds stakeholder confidence in marketing's ability to measure and optimize.
commonMistakes: Reporting metrics without context - explain what they mean
Data overload - focus on 5-8 key metrics, not 50
No recommendations - reports should drive action
Inconsistent format - makes week-over-week comparison hard
Burying the lead - start with the most important insight
tips: Build a template prompt that you update weekly with new data
Create a 'campaign context' note to give AI context on what's running
Ask AI to generate 'optimization recommendations' not just 'what happened'
Set up automated data exports where possible to reduce manual work
